docs.title: A Guide to Setting Up a Research Environment for Many-Body Computations
docs.text:
This is a step-by-step environment setup guide specially prepared for students who are about to systematically learn numerical computations for quantum many-body systems (though it may also be useful for other fields!). Whether you are using macOS, Windows, Linux, or WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux), this guide will help you build a complete and efficient research environment from scratch.

We not only cover the core computational toolchain – Python, Julia, Fortran/C/C++, MPI, BLAS/LAPACK (including OpenBLAS/MKL), PETSc/SLEPc – but also carefully include essential daily research tools: cloud storage synchronization, reference management (Zotero), version control (Git), terminal optimization, and more, to make your research work more productive.

All example codes have been tested and are hosted in the GitHub repository guide-env-setup/codes, where you can download and verify them at any time.

Author: Wen Chen · Email: wenchenphy@gmail.com · Version: 3.0.0 (2026-02-14)

docs.title: Why Synchronization Matters
docs.text:
In scientific research, cloud storage and file synchronization play an indispensable role:

  • Backup: Protect your valuable research data (papers, code, notes) from hardware failures or accidental loss.
  • Cross-Device Sync: Seamlessly access your files across lab desktops, personal laptops, tablets, and even HPC clusters.
  • Collaboration: Share folders with colleagues, co-author papers, and keep everyone up-to-date with automatic updates.

Choosing the right cloud storage service ensures that your work is always available, consistent, and secure.

docs.title: Popular Cloud Storage Services
docs.text:
Below are commonly used cloud storage platforms in academia, along with their key features:

Service Free Tier Paid Plans (Annual) Additional Features Microsoft OneDrive 5 GB 100 GB ($19.99), 1 TB ($69.99, with Microsoft 365) Deep integration with Office 365, real-time collaboration Google Drive 15 GB 100 GB ($19.99), 2 TB ($99.99), 5 TB ($249.99) Seamless integration with Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Gmail) Dropbox 2 GB 2 TB ($119.88), 3 TB ($199) Excellent cross-platform clients, file versioning Nutstore 1 GB (monthly upload limit) 30 GB ($16.86), 60 GB ($33.72) Fast in mainland China, WebDAV support, no individual file size limit

Note: Prices are approximate and may vary by region or promotion.

docs.title: Regional Recommendations
docs.text: Due to differences in network environments, the optimal choice may depend on your location:

docs.title: Mainland China
docs.text:
• Microsoft OneDrive: The desktop app works normally; web access may occasionally be restricted.
  • Nutstore: Fully accessible, fast, and stable – ideal for daily research file synchronization.
  • Dropbox and Google Drive: Cannot be used directly without additional tools.

docs.title: United States and Other Overseas Regions
docs.text:
• Dropbox: Industry standard, stable and fast.
  • Microsoft OneDrive: A great choice if you already use Microsoft 365 for writing and collaboration.
  • Google Drive: Convenient if you rely on Gmail, Google Photos, or Google Workspace.

docs.title: Cross-Platform Support and WSL
docs.text:
All major cloud storage services provide native clients for Windows, macOS, Linux, and mobile platforms, making it easy to sync your research files across different operating systems.

If you use WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux), you can directly access Windows-synced folders via the /mnt/c/ path. For example, if your OneDrive folder is located at C:\Users\<YourUsername>\OneDrive, you can access it in WSL with:

cd /mnt/c/Users/<YourUsername>/OneDrive

You can also set up an alias in your configuration file for quick access (see [Basic Terminal Commands] for details).

docs.title: 多体计算研究环境搭建指南
docs.text:
这是一份专门为即将开始系统学习量子多体系统的数值计算（也许对别的领域也有参考价值！）的同学们准备的手把手环境配置攻略。无论你使用的是macOS、Windows、Linux还是WSL（Windows Subsystem for Linux），本指南都将帮助你从零开始搭建高效、完整的科研环境。

我们不仅覆盖核心计算工具链——Python、Julia、Fortran/C/C++、MPI、BLAS/LAPACK（包括OpenBlas/MKL）、PETSc/SLEPc，还精心整理了科研日常必备工具：网盘同步、文献管理（Zotero）、版本控制（Git）、终端优化等，让你的科研工作事半功倍。

所有示例代码均已通过测试，并托管在 GitHub 仓库 guide-env-setup/codes 中，你可以随时下载验证或参考。

作者：Wen Chen · 邮箱：wenchenphy@gmail.com · 版本：3.0.0 (2026-02-14)

docs.title: 为什么同步很重要
docs.text:
在科研工作中，网盘和文件同步扮演着不可或缺的角色：

  • 备份：防止宝贵的研究数据（文献、代码、笔记）因硬件故障或意外丢失而损坏。
  • 跨设备同步：在实验室台式机、个人笔记本、平板之间无缝访问文件。
  • 协作：与同事共享文件夹，共同撰写论文，自动更新让所有人始终看到最新版本。

选择一个合适的网盘服务，能确保你的工作随时可用、保持一致且安全。

docs.title: 主流网盘服务介绍
docs.text:

docs.title: 地区推荐
docs.text: 由于不同地区的网络环境差异，建议根据所在位置选择：

docs.title: 中国大陆
docs.text:
• Microsoft OneDrive：桌面客户端可正常使用，网页端可能偶尔受限。
  • 坚果云：完全可用，速度快且稳定，非常适合日常科研文件同步。
  • Dropbox 和 Google Drive：未经特殊工具无法直接使用。

docs.title: 美国及其他海外地区
docs.text:
• Dropbox：业界标准，稳定快速。
  • Microsoft OneDrive：如果你已使用Microsoft 365进行写作和协作，这是很好的选择。
  • Google Drive：如果你依赖Gmail、Google Photos或Google Workspace，非常方便。

docs.title: 跨平台支持与 WSL
docs.text:
主流网盘服务均提供 Windows、macOS、Linux 及移动端的原生客户端，让你可以轻松地在不同操作系统间同步科研文件。

如果你使用 WSL（Windows Subsystem for Linux），可以直接通过 /mnt/c/ 路径访问 Windows 下已同步的文件夹。例如，若 OneDrive 文件夹位于 C:\Users\<你的用户名>\OneDrive，在 WSL 中可用以下命令进入：

cd /mnt/c/Users/<你的用户名>/OneDrive

你还可以在配置文件中设置别名，实现快速切换（详见[终端基本命令]）。
